articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Scattering Leaflets Hurting Dignity of Supreme Leadership of DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Scattering Leaflets Hurting Dignity of Supreme Leadership of DPRK
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet military group Monday committed such hideous provocations as firing bullets and shells from the five islands and in their vicinity in the West Sea of Korea including Paekryong Island and Taeyonphyong Island and scattering leaflets hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership and the social system in the DPRK.
					The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in its information bulletin 1058 issued Tuesday said  that such reckless actions of the puppet military gangsters can never be tolerated as they are a very serious case pushing the north-south relations to an uncontrollable  catastrophe.
					
					The above-said leaflets-scattering operation carried out on the five islands and in their vicinity in the West Sea of Korea, the biggest hotspots, is an extremely reckless action that can be perpetrated only by the puppet military hooligans steeped in confrontation hysteria to the marrow of their bones, the bulletin noted, and continued:
					
					With no rhetoric can the south Korean authorities justify the hideous provocative act of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership and the social system in the DPRK committed by the puppet military group.
					
					The south Korean chief executive had better put under control something serious happening inside south Korea, not resorting to the charade of misleading the public opinion at home and abroad by creating impression that she is interested in the improvement of the inter-Korean relations with such words as "confidence" and "unification".
					
					The reality goes to clearly prove that there can be neither improved inter-Korean relations nor peace on the Korean peninsula as long as the diehard military gangsters are allowed to dare hurt the inviolable dignity of our supreme leadership.
					
					Our army and people will never pardon even the slightest act of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership and the social system in the DPRK but deal merciless sledge-hammer blows at its perpetrators.
					
					The provocateurs will be held entirely accountable for the disastrous consequences caused to the inter-Korean relations in the future.

articles.title: Greetings to Greek President
articles.content:
Greetings to Greek President
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Carlos Papoulias, president of Greece, on the occasion of its national day.
					 Extending warm congratulations to the president and people of Greece, the message wished friendly Greece steady development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Bangladeshi President
articles.content:
Greetings to Bangladeshi President
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Abdul Hamid, president of Bangladesh, on Tuesday on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and sincerely wished the friendly Bangladeshi people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Reception Given by Pakistani Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Pakistani Ambassador
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Syed Hasan Habib, Pakistani ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Tuesday on the occasion of the Day of Pakistan.
					 Present there on invitation were Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international bodies here.
					
					 Present were staff members of the Pakistani embassy.

articles.title: Russian VIPs Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian VIPs Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Galushka, minister of the Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Russia, and his party visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Tuesday.
					 They paid respects to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il with profound reverence for the peerlessly great men who made undying contributions to boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and accomplishing the cause of global independence.
					
					 They entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 Alexandr Galushka made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Liberation Tower
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Galushka, minister of the Development of Far East who is chairman of the Russian side to the Inter-governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Russia, and his party laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower on Tuesday. 
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, officials concerned and Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The participants laid a wreath in the name of the minister of the Development of Far East and paid a silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Soviet Army.
					
					 Then they went round the tower.

articles.title: Statement of NDC of DPRK Distributed as UNSC Official Document
articles.content:
Statement of NDC of DPRK Distributed as UNSC Official Document
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK "The DPRK Clarifies Its Stand on the U.S. Hostile Policy towards It at Home and Abroad as Regards the Prevailing Situation" was distributed at the UN Security Council as an official document S/2014/194 on March 20.

articles.title: 65th Anniversary of National Peace Committee of Korea Marked
articles.content:
65th Anniversary of National Peace Committee of Korea Marked
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place here on Monday to mark the 65th anniversary of the National Peace Committee of Korea (NPCK).
					 Present at the meeting were members of the NPCK Standing Committee, representatives of Pyongyang City and local committees and honorary guests.
					
					 A report was made at the meeting to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers referred to various forms of anti-war activities for peace the committee has conducted over the past 65 years as part of efforts to ease tensions in the Korean Peninsula, achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and defend peace and security in the Northeast Asian region and the rest of the world.
					
					 They said that the danger of war is mounting in the peninsula, due to the anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK pursued by the U.S. and its followers.
					
					 The meeting called upon progressive non-governmental international organizations and pro-peace organizations in different countries to take active part in the struggle for peace and reunification of Korea with correct understanding of the present situation.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issues to invigorate the NPCK activities in the coming days.
					
					 It deliberated on and approved the amended organizational rules and elected new leading members of the committee.
					
					 After the meeting, the participants looked round the photos displayed to show the committee's activities and appreciated an art performance.

articles.title: World Water Day Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
World Water Day Observed in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- An event on the theme of "Water and Energy" took place at the Grand People's Study House on Tuesday on the occasion of the World Water Day.
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Urban Management, Ministry of Public Health, Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, Grand People's Study House and other officials concerned, staff members of the UNICEF mission here and foreign guests.
					
					 Speeches were made at the event.
					
					 Lectures were given under the titles "On World Water Day", "On use of water and energy in our country" and "Survey results on use of waterworks across the country in 2013."
					
					 Lecturers said that the DPRK has instilled importance of water into the people on the occasion of the World Water Day every year.
					
					 They stressed the need to know better about co-relations between water and energy and pay deep attention to the work for saving precious water.
					
					 The participants watched the Korean science film "Gravity-fed Waterworks" and looked round photos on display.

articles.title: State Commendations Awarded to Meritorious Service Personnel, Officials, Working People
articles.content:
State Commendations Awarded to Meritorious Service Personnel, Officials, Working People
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- State commendations were awarded to service personnel, officials and other people who distinguished themselves in building the Masikryong Ski Resort at due ceremonies held by units of the Korean People's Army and various organs of  the DPRK.
					 Order of Kim Il Sung was conferred on Im Jong Sik and Yun Hak Yong and Order of Kim Jong Il on Kim Yun Ha.
					
					 The title of Labor Hero of the DPRK and Gold Medal (Hammer and Sickle) and Order of National Flag First Class were awarded to Pak Sung Won, Yun Kwang Nam, Hong Chol, Ri Man Su, Min Thae Sik and Ri Chang Gon.
					
					 Watches bearing the august name of President Kim Il Sung went to O Pyong Chol, Sim Song Il and 10 other persons.
					
					 Citation of KPA Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un was conferred on Sin Ki Chol, Ri Sun Gil, An Kwang Hyon and 15 other persons.
					
					 Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize was awarded to Kim Myong Jin, Kim Mi Yong, Han Won Hak, Ro Myong San and Ri Yong Myong and Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize to Ho Chol Min, Chae Jong Gwan, Sin Kil Ho and Choe Kuk Chol.
					
					 The title of Merited Driver went to Ri Kwang Bok and Kang Song Il, the title of Merited Designer to Kim Yong Ho, the title of Merited Technician to Kim Myong Chol and the title of Merited Builder to Kang Won Yong.
					
					 Order of National Flag First Class was awarded to 43 persons, Order of Labor to 24 persons and other orders and medals to many service personnel, officials and other people.

articles.title: Volleyball Games of Agricultural Workers Take Place
articles.content:
Volleyball Games of Agricultural Workers Take Place
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Volleyball games of agricultural workers across the country took place here from March 20 to 25.
					 They brought together men and women players of 24 organizations from Pyongyang and all provinces.
					
					 Men and women players of South Hwanghae Province placed first as they conducted the games in a tactical way through strong overhand service, quick kill and jump stop.

articles.title: Drought Continues in DPRK
articles.content:
Drought Continues in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A spell of dry weather has continued for more than 40 days from February 10, with no rainfall or a little in most parts of Pyongyang, South Phyongan, North Hwanghae and South Hwanghae provinces and some parts of North Phyongan, Kangwon, Jagang and South Hamgyong provinces.
					 The average precipitation stands at around 1.6 mm in the western coastal and central inland areas, the lowest since Juche 50 (1961). 
					
					 No rainfall is expected in those areas until mid-April.

articles.title: Jang Sung Op, Celebrated Korean Painter
articles.content:
Jang Sung Op, Celebrated Korean Painter
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Among famous Korean painters was Jang Sung Op, who was active in the 19th century.
					 Jang lived a poor life, but devoted himself to creating a peculiar art of painting characterized by vivid portrayal of subjects.
					
					 His main subjects were animals, flowers and birds.
					
					 One of his works is "Prunus Mume (Japanese apricot)" drawn on a ten-fold screen, successfully depicting an old tree with fine brush strokes.
					
					 Jang in his work "Soldiers and Horses" gave a lifelike portrayal of galloping horses and riders.
					
					 Included in his works are also paintings of still life.

articles.title: Revolutionary Spirit of Paektu Is Valuable Wealth of Korean Revolution: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Revolutionary Spirit of Paektu Is Valuable Wealth of Korean Revolution: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il made public the famous work "Let Us Cultivate the Revolutionary Spirit of Paektu among the Rising Generation" on March 24, Juche 58 (1969) to clarify the theoretical and practical matters for the rising generation to thoroughly arm themselves with the revolutionary spirit of Paektu and live and struggle in the spirit. 
					 The revolutionary spirit of Paektu which was created in the flames of the anti-Japanese armed struggle organized by President Kim Il Sung is the spirit of remaining loyal to the idea and cause of the leader, the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and fortitude overcoming difficulties with one's own efforts and the indomitable fighting spirit. 
					
					 The revolutionary spirit of Paektu is the valuable wealth of the Korean revolution to be inherited down through generations, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article. 
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 This spirit can never change though many years have gone by and generations were placed with new ones. We should make to the end generation after generation the march started on Mt. Paektu, along the course of Juche. 
					
					 The revolutionary spirit and precious soul of the anti-Japanese forerunners serve as the basic source which helped create the great tradition of unity and cohesion of the revolutionary ranks centered on the leader, and the powerful engine which helped the younger generation dynamically advance along the road of the revolution under the guidance of the leader. 
					
					 The younger generation of the DPRK is turning out as one in the drive for building a thriving nation, bearing deep in mind for what did the forerunners fight at the cost of lives and work harder than others. 
					
					 The younger generation of the Korean revolution who inherited the revolutionary spirit of Paektu as precious mental legacy will advance straight to the last along the path of Juche despite whatever storm and stress.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Make Policy Decision in Line with Trend of Times
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Make Policy Decision in Line with Trend of Times
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is sadly mistaken if it thinks it can get something by putting pressure upon the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article. It goes on:
					 The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK will go into bankruptcy in the end.
					
					 This has been proved by the history of confrontation between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The successive U.S. administrations have ever pursued the hostile policy towards the DPRK. The general orientation of the policy is to swallow up the DPRK by force. But the U.S. has suffered bitter defeat only.
					
					 The U.S. should look back upon the defeat in the past Korean War and the long-standing confrontation with the DPRK and draw a lesson.
					
					 It is the demand of the Korean people, mankind and the times that the U.S. should roll back its anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 The outdated U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK is bound to go bust in the end as it ignores the trend of the times and fails to properly understand its rival.
					
					 It is beneficial to the U.S. itself to roll back its old hostile policy towards the DPRK at an early date and work out a new realistic policy, before it is too late.
					
					 In case the U.S. fails to make a correct choice, the DPRK's access to war deterrent will be prolonged and strengthened. And catastrophic consequences to be inflicted on the U.S will be increased so much. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to make a cool judgment of the situation and make a policy decision in line with the trend of the times.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Rejecting Foreign Forces and Achieving National Cooperation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Rejecting Foreign Forces and Achieving National Cooperation
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article says it is a sure guarantee for independent reunification to reject foreign forces and achieve national cooperation.
					 National cooperation is essential for the Korean nation to dynamically advance the cause of independent reunification in keeping with the aspiration and demand of the times, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 National cooperation is the basic mode of struggle to frustrate the moves of foreign forces for aggression and achieve national reunification and prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 The U.S., the very one who severed the blood vessel and territory of Korea into two, is invariably pursuing the hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean nation should resolutely reject outsiders' moves for domination and interference and cooperation with them, always hold fast to the independent stand of the nation and settle all the issues through national cooperation in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 It should stand firm against sycophancy and acts of treachery.
					
					 Cooperation with foreign forces is the way of opposing reunification and the way of a war against the north. If one truly wants confidence-building and development of relations between the north and the south, one should reject the U.S. aggressive hostile policy towards the DPRK and abandon cooperation with it.
					
					 Only when national cooperation is achieved, is it possible to make a breakthrough in the efforts for the development of inter-Korean relations and peace and reunification of the country.
					
					 National cooperation is, indeed, the shortcut to national reunification and prosperity.

articles.title: Large-scale Command Post Drills of U.S., S. Korean Marine Corps Staged
articles.content:
Large-scale Command Post Drills of U.S., S. Korean Marine Corps Staged
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- U.S. Marines staged large-scale command post drills together with the south Korean marine corps in Phohang, North Kyongsang Province, Taegu and other areas from March 15 to 23, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Involved there were the 3rd marine troops of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces who had been hurled into south Korea by transport planes and transport craft and a large number of troops of the south Korean marine corps.
					
					 The warmongers were busy with war drills for rapidly deploying their troops and hardware through a network connection between Phohang where the command post was operating and Taegu where the troops were conducting operations under various simulated conditions on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is the first time that the U.S. marines staged such drills after forming a group of staff officers for a combat together with the south Korean marine corps.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are escalating the war exercises for aggression pursuant to their scenario for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, pushing the situation on the peninsula to the worst phase.

articles.title: U.S. Army Chief of Staff's Nonsensical Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Army Chief of Staff's Nonsensical Remarks under Fire
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The chief of Staff of the U.S. Army recently jabbered that the biggest concern over the issue on the Korean peninsula is the possibility of the outbreak of a war due to a misjudgment and that the misjudgment can lead to an undesired provocation on the peninsula.
					 This means that the U.S. wishes for peace and stability on the peninsula but it is worried about the escalation of tension and the possible outbreak of a war on the peninsula by the DPRK.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary notes that no matter what a whole gamut of sophism the U.S. may run and nonsensical remarks it may make, it can never evade the responsibility for harassing peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 The Korean peninsula has become the world's biggest hotspot and a powder keg which may go off any time and the U.S. is wholly to blame for this, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 This being the hard fact, the U.S. is talking about "concern" about the "possible outbreak of a war". This is ridiculous rubbish that can be talked by brazen-faced guys only.
					
					 The U.S. is busy floating such misinformation, lost to shame. This behavior only reveals its embarrassing position.
					
					 The world clearly knows the reason why the situation remains so tense on the peninsula and who is to blame for it.
					
					 Not content with occupying the half of the land of other country, the U.S. seeks to swallow up the whole of Korea. This gangster-like scenario can never be justified.
					
					 The U.S. had better protect its own house, before having an eye on other's house and thinking of invading it.

articles.title: Over 20,000 S. Korean Workers Protest Authorities' Anti-Worker Measure
articles.content:
Over 20,000 S. Korean Workers Protest Authorities' Anti-Worker Measure
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- At least 20,000 south Korean workers held a rally in Seoul on March 22 and protested against the authorities' plan to privatize the public sectors, according to the south Korean MBC.
					 The speakers at the rally said the "government" set out the "measure of putting the operation of the public sectors on a normal basis".
					
					 This is nothing but a deceptive motto to realize the restructuring of the public sectors, they said, demanding an immediate withdrawal of the measure.

articles.title: Statement of NDC of DPRK Supported by Organizations of Peru, Ethiopia
articles.content:
Statement of NDC of DPRK Supported by Organizations of Peru, Ethiopia
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Peru and Ethiopia extended support to the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK on March 18.
					 The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism stated:
					
					 The U.S. is the primary target of condemnation as it brought a nuclear disaster to the world and savagely killed Koreans during the past Korean War.
					
					 The U.S. is still infringing upon the sovereignty and human rights of other countries and nations.
					
					 The Korean people is the heroic one who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists, united close around their leader, and victoriously advanced the socialist revolution.
					
					 The U.S. should properly understand the DPRK and behave itself.
					
					 We extend invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people in their anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. struggle and are convinced of their final victory.
					
					 The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea said in its statement:
					
					 The U.S. "sanctions", "isolation and blockade" and undisguised military threats to the DPRK over its nuclear deterrent for self-defence are pushing the situation on the Korean peninsula to the unpredictable brink of war. The U.S. "human rights" campaign being escalated against the latter on the basis of lies is reaching an extreme phase.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is the harshest one to undermine the ideology and bring down social system of the latter by dint of American-style democracy and military muscle.
					
					 We support the DPRK's stand clarified in the statement of the NDC.
					
					 We, at the same time, strongly demand the U.S. make a policy decision to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and immediately stop its "human rights" campaign against the latter.

articles.title: U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Accused by Organizations of Indonesia, Nigeria
articles.content:
U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Accused by Organizations of Indonesia, Nigeria
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Indonesia and Nigeria issued statements on March 16 and 17 in denunciation of the ever-more undisguised U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK.
					 The Indonesian Federation of Transport Workers Unions said:
					
					 It is only the Korean peninsula where the tragedy of territorial and national division is going on and military tension and war danger are escalating due to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK which is being modified and supplemented with harsher contents with each passing day.
					
					 The U.S. "sanctions", "isolation and blockade" and undisguised military threats to the DPRK over its nuclear deterrent for self-defence are pushing the situation on the Korean peninsula to the unpredictable brink of war and the former's "human rights" racket has reached an extreme phase, going beyond the danger level.
					
					 The U.S. should drop its bad habit of interfering in the internal affairs of other countries incurring its displeasure, and perpetrating aggression against them.
					
					 We urge the U.S. to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and lift all measures pursuant to it, have a correct understanding and viewpoint stand on the latter's nuclear deterrent and immediately stop its groundless "human rights" campaign against the latter.
					
					 The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association noted:
					
					 The U.S. has resorted to cunning and foolish moves to undermine the ideology and bring down social system of the DPRK, groundlessly finding fault with whatever done by the Korean people for the past several decades. 
					
					 The U.S. should drop the bad habit of taking issue with other's affairs and make a policy decision to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK as soon as possible.
					
					 The final victory is in store for the Korean people struggling for justice.

articles.title: Political Party of Ghana Urges U.S. to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
Political Party of Ghana Urges U.S. to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The National Democratic Congress of Ghana released a statement on March 16 in support of the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The leadership of the National Democratic Congress of Ghana expresses full support for the statement of the NDC of the DPRK urging the U.S. to make a policy decision to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy towards it and lift all the measures pursuant to the policy.
					
					 Everybody has the right to choose his or her way but no one is entitled to impose one's will upon the other.
					
					 Moreover, for one to judge others with one's standards and dictate this or that is a clear interference in the internal affairs.
					
					 This is a practice quite contrary to the present reality.
					
					 We demand the U.S. unconditionally respond to the demand of the NDC of the DPRK and roll back at once all forms of hostile policies towards the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Highly Praised in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Highly Praised in Nepal
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was the greatest leader in the world history of politics as he was boundlessly revered by all people for leading the Korean revolution under the uplifted banner of independence for a long period and thereby bringing about great socio-economic changes and recording a brilliant chapter in the history of the struggle for human emancipation.
					 The Nepali national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) said this in an inaugural declaration on March 15.
					
					 The declaration went on:
					
					 April 15 is the day of historic significance for the world progressive people.
					
					 The Korean people mark the Day of the Sun as the greatest national holiday and progressive mankind regard it as a great day symbolic of the victorious advance of the cause of global independence.
					
					 We have formed the Nepali national preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun to most significantly celebrate this day.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of Kyrgyzstan for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Bishkek on March 17. 
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party who doubles as chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events praising the exploits of the President on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Tajikistan
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Tajikistan
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of Tajikistan for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Dushanbe on March 18. 
					 Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Nepal
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Nepal
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A Nepali national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed on March 15.
					 The national preparatory committee was organized with personages of various political parties, friendly and social organizations, organizations for the study of the Juche idea and media in Nepal.
					
					 C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Malaysia
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Malaysia
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A Malaysian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed on March 18.
					 The manager of the Dombo Enterprise Company was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee set a celebration period till April 18 and decided to organize diverse political and cultural events in the period.
					
					 The chairman said:
					
					 I regard the formation of the Malaysian preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun as great pride.
					
					 It is the bounden duty and sense of obligation not only of the Korean people but of progressive humankind to significantly celebrate the birth anniversaries of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Peruvian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Peruvian Paper
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The main contents of the New Year Address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un was carried by the March issue of the Peruvian paper Accion Nacionalista.
					 The paper carried a photo documenting his revolutionary activities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Love for People Praised by Korean in U.S.
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Love for People Praised by Korean in U.S.
Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Ro Kil Nam, representative of Minjok Thongsin, internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., contributed an article titled  "Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's love touches compatriots in the north" to the paper.
					 The article said that the story about Kim Jong Un's love touches everybody.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 There are so many legendary stories about his love for people and all-embracing politics. To cite just an example, he let a pupil who was exemplary in study and in the Children's Union organizational life take part in the event for celebrating the 66th anniversary of the founding of the Korean Children's Union without any discrimination though the pupil's father had committed a crime against the country.
					
					 The stories about his love are gripping the hearts of the compatriots in the north.
					
					 That is why all compatriots in the north are expressing profound reverence for their leader.
					
					 The DPRK is the only country in the world where the people hold their leader in high esteem.
					
					 I could notice such intense loyalty in everybody I met.
					
					 This made me keenly realize what sheer lies the U.S. and its supporters are spreading while kicking up smear campaign.
					
					 The DPRK respects its sovereignty, projects the popular masses as the leading players of history and lays emphasis on their independence, creativity and conscience.
					
					 No guys are so ignorant as describing such society in which all people lead life worthy of man as masters as "society with poor human rights record." 
					
					 Society in the north is an ideal one desired by mankind.
					
					 That's true. There are some in short supply in the north. But in a word, one may say it is sound in all aspects including politics, military, cutting-edge science, music and arts, education and social culture.
					
					 The service personnel and people single-mindedly united around their leader move in perfect order.
					
					 The leader pursues the politics of believing in people as in Heaven while the service personnel and people hold him in high esteem.
					
					 The service personnel and people loudly sing songs "We Know Nobody but You", "Ardent Desire", etc. that reverberate far and wide in the north.
					
					 Those songs reflect the warm hearts of the service personnel and people in the north for the leader. 
					
					 The foundations remain strong and the prospect rosy in all fabrics of society in the DPRK where the Songun politics is in force. Therefore, the DPRK has bright and rosy future.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Grecia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Grecia
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 25 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Grecia, Carlos Papoulias, con motivo del dia nacional de ese pais. 
					El remitente extiende calidas felicitaciones al mandatario y pueblo griegos y desea al amistoso pais europeo constante desarrollo y prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Bangladesh
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Bangladesh
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 25 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Popular de Bangladesh, Abdul Hamid, con motivo del 43o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro, el remitente desea al amistoso pueblo bengali mayor progreso y prosperidad.

articles.title: CNCDP celebra 65o aniversario de su fundacion
articles.content:
CNCDP celebra 65o aniversario de su fundacion
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 24 en esta capital la conferencia para celebrar el 65o aniversario del Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz (CNCDP).
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los miembros del Presidium del CNCDP, los delegados de las organizaciones de Pyongyang y otras localidades y los huespedes honorarios.
					
					En el acto hubo informe e intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores mencionaron que durante 65 anos pasados el CNCDP ha venido desplegando variadas actividades anti-guerra y por la paz para aliviar la tension de la Peninsula Coreana, lograr la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de Corea y defender la paz y la estabilidad de la region del Nordeste Asiatico y el resto del mundo.
					
					Subrayaron que hoy en dia en la Peninsula Coreana se aumenta mas que nunca el peligro de guerra, a consecuencia de la anacronica politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
					
					Y exhortaron a las progresistas organizaciones internacionales no gubernamentales y las entidades del movimiento por la paz de cada pais a sumarse a la lucha para apoyar la paz y la reunificacion de Corea, al tener una comprension correcta sobre la situacion actual.
					
					En el acto fueron abordados los temas que se presentan en la labor para desarrollar en adelante las actividades del CNCDP.
					
					Y fue considerado y aprobado el modificado estatuto de la organizacion y se eligieron  nuevos miembros del organo directivo.
					
					Al termino del acto, los participantes pasaron revista a las fotos que dan a conocer las actividades del tiempo pasado de su organizacion y presenciaron la funcion  conmemorativa.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de Agua
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de Agua
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 25 en el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo el acto intitulado "Agua y energia" dedicado al Dia Mundial de Agua.
					En la ocasion participaron los funcionarios del Ministerio de Urbanismo, el Ministerio de Salud Publica, el Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental, dicho palacio y otros interesados, los miembros de la representacion del Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF) en Corea y los huespedes extranjeros.
					
					Hubo intervenciones.
					
					Se impartio la leccion intitulada "Sobre el Dia Mundial de Agua", "Sobre el uso de agua y energia en Corea" y "Resultado de investigacion sobre el uso de instalaciones de abastecimiento de agua de todo el pais en 2013".
					
					Los oradores senalaron que con motivo de este dia, hicieron conocer a los habitantes la importancia del agua.
					
					Subrayaron que se deberan prestar atencion al ahorro del agua sabiendo bien las correlaciones entre el agua y la energia.
					
					Los participantes vieron el documental cientifico de Corea "Acueducto por gravedad" y las fotos exhibidas.

articles.title: Jang Sung Op, pintor famoso coreano en siglo 19
articles.content:
Jang Sung Op, pintor famoso coreano en siglo 19
Pyongyang, 25 de marzo (ACNC) -- Jang Sung Op fue el pintor representante de la pintura coreana quien dejo su nombre en el siglo 19 por su peculiar metodo de pintar.
					Aunque vivia en la penuria, conseguia las pinturas famosas para estudiarlas y adiestrar el metodo de dibujar.
					
					Con las experiencias de creacion y los esfuerzos de largo plazo, se libero del diseno monotono e inerte del pasado y describio las figuras mas vivas que revelan la esencia del objeto.
					
					Preferia dibujar los animales, las flores y las aves.
					
					El "Endrino" dibujado por el en un biombo grande es uno de sus obras mas conocidas.
					
					El otro dibujo alusivo a dos hombres y siete caballos, tambien pintado por el, muestra bien el caracter originario y los movimientos de los caballos.
					
					Entre las pinturas de Jong figuran ademas las piezas alusivas a la naturaleza muerta.
